text: this second that you hear green garlic
is in season run and get some and you
know what you should do with it
make tabbouleh salad what you're looking
for
are tender stems that you can chop up
really finely and they're just very
sweet to eat this is the recipe to make
in springtime when you can get beautiful
green garlic or you can get ramps so
take advantage strike while the greens
are floppy tabbouleh salad should be
more green than beige so in order to up
the ante on the greens we have to bring
in a lot of them so I have green garlic
I've got parsley fresh mint and then
some scallions scallions give it an
oniony flavor as opposed to the garlicky
flavor a little bit of sweetness as well
bulgur is cracked wheat and it comes in
different sizes there's very fine bulgur
there's medium bulgur there's large
bulgur for this you want to use the
medium it kind of splits the difference
between being a little too mushy and
being a little too coarse drain it let
it cool and make sure it cools before
you add it to the greens because it'll
cook them and you want the freshness you
want that crisp white dressing for
tabbouleh salad is very simple it's
usually just a combination of lemon
juice and olive oil I've also added some
cumin and some allspice just to give it
a little perfume tomato and cucumber are
very traditional additions to a
tabbouleh salad the cucumber adds sort
of juicy crisp texture mmm the tomato
adds sweetness tabbouleh salad is
perfect with grilled beets so if you've
got your grill going throw on some
kebabs
it's the perfect accompaniment
